citation.article-title: Bifidobacterium scardovii sp. nov., from human sources.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Bifidobacterium scardovii sp. nov.
Bifidobacterium scardovii (scar.dov'i.i. N.L. gen. n. scardovii of Scardovi; named after Vittorio Scardovi, in recognition of his contribution to our knowledge of the bifidobacteria)
Gram-positive, non-acid-fast, non-motile, asporogenous rod-shaped cells, some of which are curved.
Facultatively anaerobic and catalase-negative.
Weak haemolysis is observed on Columbia blood agar.
Colonies are 2-3 mm in diameter, convex, shiny, with a dense white centre.
End products of glucose fermentation are acetic and L-lactic acid.
No gas production is observed.
Using API systems, acid is produced from L-arabinose, lactose, mannose, maltose, melibiose, raffinose, ribose, sucrose and trehalose.
Acid is not produced from D-arabitol, cyclodextrin, pullulan, glycogen, mannitol, methyl β-D-glucopyranoside, sorbitol or tagatose.
Acid may or may not be produced from melezitose.
Hippurate is not hydrolysed.

Activity of alanine phenylalanine proline arylamidase, arginine arylamidase, α-arabinosidase, α-fucosidase, α-glucosidase, β-glucosidase, α-galactosidase, β-galactosidase, glycine arylamidase, histidine arylamidase, leucine arylamidase, phenyl alanine arylamidase, pyroglutamic acid arylamidase, serine arylamidase and tyrosine arylamidase is observed.

No activity is observed for alkaline phosphatase, arginine dihydrolase, β-galactosidase-6-phosphate, glutamic acid decarboxylase, glutamyl glutamic acid arylamidase, glycyl tryptophan arylamidase, proline arylamidase or leucyl glycine arylamidase.
Activity may or may not be observed for alanine arylamidase, bglucuronidase, N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase, β-mannosidase and urease.
Acetoin is not produced.
Indole-negative.
Nitrate is not reduced to nitrite.
Cell wall murein is of the A3α type, L-Lys-L-Ser-L-Ala2.
Isolated from human clinical sources.
Habitat is not known.
The type strain is CCUG 13008T (=DSM 13734T) and it was isolated from human blood.
G+­C content of the type strain is 60.1 mol%.
